name: chest wall lesion
description: A lesion located within or on the chest wall.

name: bilateral hyperinflated lungs
description: Both lungs appear overinflated with increased lung volume.

name: pleural mass
description: A discrete mass or tumor arising from the pleura.

name: breast soft tissue lesion
description: A breast soft tissue lesion refers to any abnormal growth or mass within the soft tissue of the breast, which may include various entities such as cysts, fibromas, or malignant tumors, typically identified through imaging modalities like mammography or ultrasound.

name: pulmonary artery aneurysm
description: Abnormal focal dilatation of the pulmonary artery.

name: acyanotic congenital heart disease with increased pulmonary vascularity
description: Congenital cardiac malformations that do not cause cyanosis and result in increased blood flow to the lungs.

name: tricuspid insufficiency
description: Incompetent tricuspid valve causing regurgitation of blood from right ventricle to right atrium.

name: pulmonary lobar enlargement
description: Increased size of a pulmonary lobe, can be due to air trapping or other etiologies.

name: multiple pulmonary nodules
description: Two or more round opacities scattered throughout the lungs.

name: abnormal azygoesophageal recess
description: Altered contour or appearance of the azygoesophageal recess, which may indicate mediastinal or esophageal pathology.

name: solitary pulmonary mass
description: A single abnormal mass seen in lung parenchyma greater than 3 cm.

name: dilated azygos vein
description: Enlargement of the azygos vein.

name: pulmonary artery catheterization
description: Presence of a catheter (Swan-Ganz) in the pulmonary artery.

name: calcified pulmonary metastasis
description: Metastatic lung lesion with areas of calcification.

name: abnormal sternomanubrial synchondrosis
description: Abnormality at the junction between the sternum and manubrium, such as widening or irregularity.

name: aortic aneurysm
description: Abnormal dilation of a segment of the aorta, usually due to weakening of the vessel wall.

name: pleural effusion containing eosinophiles
description: Pleural effusion with a high eosinophil count, often related to infection or trauma.

name: filling defect in right ventricle
description: An abnormal area within the right ventricle where contrast does not fill, often due to thrombus or tumor.

name: congenital lobar emphysema
description: Overinflation of one or more lung lobes present from birth.

name: pneumoconiosis
description: A group of occupational interstitial lung diseases caused by inhalation of inorganic dust.

name: multifocal thoracic calcification
description: Presence of calcified deposits at multiple sites in the thorax.

name: massive cardiomegaly
description: Severe enlargement of the heart beyond normal limits.

name: cardiomegaly in childhood
description: Enlarged heart size seen in pediatric patients.

name: right anterior cardiophrenic angle lesion
description: A focal mass or opacity located in the right anterior cardiophrenic angle.

name: chest malformation
description: Abnormal structural development of the bony or soft tissue chest.

name: bilateral elevated diaphragm
description: Both hemidiaphragms appear elevated relative to normal anatomic position.

name: diaphragmatic hernia
description: Protrusion of abdominal contents into the thoracic cavity through the diaphragm.

name: calcified mediastinal mass
description: A mass in the mediastinum containing areas of calcification.

name: right-to-left ventricular shunt
description: Abnormal communication allowing blood flow from the right to left ventricle.

name: hypertension
description: Elevated systemic arterial blood pressure; not directly diagnosable by chest imaging.

name: thin-walled lung cavity
description: A lung cavity with thin walls, may suggest benign etiology or certain infections.

name: small lung nodules
description: Discrete, small round opacities in the lung parenchyma.

name: intratracheal mass
description: A mass lesion located within the tracheal lumen.

name: extensive pulmonary opacity with cavitation
description: Large area of lung opacity with cavitation, seen in infections, malignancy, or infarction.

name: complicated atrial shunt
description: Presence of an abnormal communication between atria with complications such as shunt reversal or obstruction.

name: unilateral pulmonary arterial hypervascularity
description: Increased blood flow or density of pulmonary arteries on one side.

name: chronic aspiration pneumonia in a child
description: Recurrent or persistent lung infection in children due to chronic aspiration.

name: mild or intermittent cyanosis in first week
description: Bluish discoloration due to low oxygen levels in a neonate's first week, possible clinical sign of cardiopulmonary disease.

name: abnormal position of the heart
description: The heart is positioned abnormally within the thoracic cavity.

name: achalasia
description: Esophageal motility disorder resulting in failure of the lower esophageal sphincter to relax.

name: premature laryngeal cartilage calcification
description: Calcification of the laryngeal cartilages earlier than typically expected by age.

name: prosthetic valve regurgitation
description: Leakage of blood backward through a prosthetic heart valve.

name: pulmonary edema
description: Accumulation of fluid within the lung interstitium and alveoli.

name: diaphragm dysfunction
description: Abnormal function or movement of the diaphragm.

name: embolus
description: A clot or other material that travels and obstructs a blood vessel, often in the pulmonary arteries.

name: superior mediastinal mass
description: An abnormal mass located in the superior mediastinum.

name: heart failure in the first week of life
description: Cardiac failure presenting within the first week of life, often due to congenital heart disease.

name: localized chronic pulmonary opacity
description: A persistent area of increased density in the lung, typically indicating a chronic process.

name: diffuse interstitial lung disease with associated lymphadenopathy
description: Diffuse interstitial involvement of the lungs and enlarged lymph nodes.

name: small thymus in an infant
description: Thymus gland is smaller than expected for age in an infant.

name: laryngeal anomaly
description: Congenital or acquired structural abnormality of the larynx.

name: short trachea
description: A trachea that is abnormally short, potentially congenital or due to surgical resection.

name: defect in distal sternum
description: A structural anomaly or absence in the lower part of the sternum.

name: anterior mediastinal lesion
description: Any mass or abnormality located in the anterior mediastinum.

name: tracheomalacia
description: Weakness of the tracheal wall, causing collapse during expiration.

name: mass in a pulmonary cavity
description: A soft tissue nodule or mass within a pre-existing lung cavity.

name: generalized pulmonary arterial hypovascularity
description: Reduced caliber and number of pulmonary arteries visualized throughout the lung fields.

name: Mammographic malignancy assessment
description: Estimates of the likelihood of malignancy based on mammography features.

name: bilateral pulmonary underaeration
description: Both lungs show decreased aeration, often appearing denser on imaging.

name: pulmonary artery stenosis
description: Narrowing of the pulmonary artery or its branches.

name: pediatric chest tumor
description: A neoplastic mass located in the chest of a pediatric patient.

name: opportunistic lung infection
description: Pulmonary infection occurring in immunocompromised patients.

name: aortic dissection
description: Aortic dissection is a critical condition characterized by the separation of the aortic wall layers due to an intimal tear, resulting in an intramural hematoma and potential rupture; it often presents with severe, acute chest or back pain and may lead to life-threatening complications.

name: randomly distributed small lung nodules
description: Multiple small round opacities scattered randomly throughout the lung parenchyma.

name: unilateral diffuse lung disease
description: Widespread parenchymal abnormality affecting only one lung.

name: anomaly of inferior vena cava
description: Congenital or acquired abnormality involving the inferior vena cava.

name: thoracolumbar gibbus
description: Sharp angular kyphosis at thoracolumbar junction, often due to vertebral collapse or dysplasia.

name: third mogul sign
description: A radiographic sign of enlargement of the left atrial appendage.

name: vapor-induced lung disease
description: Lung injury or abnormality secondary to inhalation of vaporized substances.

name: axillary mass
description: Abnormal soft tissue mass located in the axillary (armpit) region.

name: cystic mediastinal mass
description: A cystic lesion located in the mediastinum.

name: bilateral basilar lung disease
description: Disease process involving both lower lobes of the lungs.

name: undersegmentation of sternum
description: Congenital failure of normal segmentation of the sternum, with fewer than usual parts visible.

name: bilateral flat diaphragm
description: Both hemidiaphragms appear abnormally flattened, often due to hyperinflation.

name: unilateral hyperlucency of chest
description: Increased radiolucency of one hemithorax, often caused by air trapping or technical factors.

name: tracheal agenesis
description: Congenital absence of the trachea.

name: multiple cavitary lung lesions
description: Several areas in the lung with central lucency or cavities.

name: ill-defined multifocal lung opacities
description: Multiple poorly marginated areas of increased attenuation within the lungs.

name: increased lung lucency
description: Areas of the lungs appearing darker than normal due to increased air or decreased density.

name: right-to-left shunt or admixture lesion in congenital heart disease
description: Presence of cardiac or vascular lesions in congenital heart disease that allow deoxygenated blood to mix with oxygenated blood.

name: right-to-left shunt at ductus level
description: Abnormal passage of blood from the right to left through a persistent ductus arteriosus.
synonyms: patent ductus arteriosus with right-to-left shunt

name: perilymphatic small lung nodules
description: Small nodules distributed along lymphatic routes in the lung, often associated with sarcoidosis or pneumoconioses.

name: water-attenuation mediastinal lesion
description: A lesion in the mediastinum that has density similar to water on CT imaging.

name: pulmonary arterial hypertension
description: Elevated pressure within the pulmonary arterial system.

name: pediatric chest wall lesion
description: Pathologic process affecting the chest wall in a child.

name: acute mediastinitis
description: Acute infection and inflammation of mediastinal tissues.

name: infectious lung disease
description: Any infection involving lung parenchyma, such as pneumonia or tuberculosis.

name: short narrow thoracic cage
description: A thoracic cage that is both diminished in height and width, usually congenital.

name: long linear lung shadow
description: A straight or slightly curved linear opacity seen within the lung on imaging.

name: left-to-right shunt in congenital heart disease
description: Abnormal blood flow from the left to the right side of the heart due to a congenital defect.

name: segmental atelectasis
description: Collapse of a segment of a lung resulting in volume loss and increased opacity.

name: bronchiectasis
description: Abnormal, irreversible dilatation of bronchi due to chronic inflammation or infection.

name: main pulmonary artery obstruction
description: Blockage of the main pulmonary artery, most commonly due to thromboembolism.

name: displacement of the thoracic paraspinal line
description: Alteration in the location of the paraspinal interface on imaging.

name: small heart
description: A heart that appears reduced in size relative to the thoracic cavity.

name: posterior mediastinal lesion
description: A mass or abnormality located in the posterior compartment of the mediastinum.

name: chronic disseminated air-space opacity
description: Widespread, persistent lung opacities affecting air-spaces, seen over time.

name: alveolar lung disease
description: Pulmonary process characterized by filling of alveolar spaces, seen as airspace opacification.

name: chylothorax
description: Collection of lymphatic fluid (chyle) in the pleural space.

name: paralyzed hemidiaphragm
description: Loss of movement of one side of the diaphragm, usually due to nerve injury.

name: large ascending aorta
description: Enlargement of the ascending segment of the aorta.

name: superior vena cava syndrome
description: Obstruction of the superior vena cava causing venous congestion and swelling.

name: miliary lung opacities in a neonate or young infant
description: Diffuse, tiny pulmonary opacities in a young infant or neonate.

name: peribronchovascular interstitial thickening
description: Thickening of the connective tissues around the bronchi and vessels, often associated with interstitial lung diseases.

name: clavicle hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment or incomplete formation of the clavicle.

name: unilateral flat diaphragm
description: Flattening of one hemidiaphragm, often indicating volume loss or air trapping.

name: aortic valve disease
description: General term encompassing disorders of the aortic valve including stenosis and regurgitation.

name: dextrocardia
description: Heart positioned on the right side of the chest.

name: phrenic nerve paralysis or dysfunction
description: Loss or reduction of phrenic nerve function leading to diaphragmatic elevation or immobility.

name: air-space opacity in leukemia or lymphoma
description: Pulmonary opacities occurring in patients with leukemia or lymphoma, often due to infection, hemorrhage, or infiltration.

name: gas embolism
description: The presence of gas bubbles within the vascular system, potentially causing obstruction.

name: lung abscess
description: A localized collection of pus within the lung parenchyma caused by infection.

name: multiple pleural masses
description: More than one mass lesion arising from or involving the pleura.

name: bubbly lungs in infants and children
description: Appearance of multiple small cystic or bubbly lucencies in the lungs of pediatric patients.

name: unilateral pulmonary edema
description: Edema affecting one lung or lobe, usually from cardiac, vascular or airway causes.

name: constrictive pericarditis
description: Chronic inflammation of the pericardium resulting in constriction of the heart.

name: pleural effusion with disease in thorax
description: Pleural fluid accumulation secondary to intrathoracic diseases like pneumonia or malignancy.
synonyms: secondary pleural effusion due to thoracic disease

name: acute diffuse mediastinal widening
description: Rapidly developing enlargement of the mediastinum which may indicate hemorrhage or mass.

name: right-to-left atrial shunt
description: Abnormal passage allowing blood to move from the right atrium to the left atrium.

name: marked hilar lymphadenopathy
description: Significantly enlarged lymph nodes in the hilar regions.

name: unilaterally elevated diaphragm
description: Elevation of one hemidiaphragm, typically due to paralysis, eventration, or abdominal pathology.

name: ribbon-like ribs
description: Ribs that appear thin and elongated on imaging, usually seen in conditions that affect bone development.

name: thoracic dysplasia
description: Abnormal development or formation of the thoracic structures, typically congenital.

name: soft-tissue mediastinal mass
description: Mass or lesion composed of soft tissue within the mediastinum.

name: marked cyanosis in first week of life
description: Severe bluish discoloration of skin in neonates caused by inadequate oxygenation, often due to congenital heart disease.

name: pericardial calcification
description: Calcium deposition within the pericardium, frequently seen in chronic inflammation.

name: lung disease with eosinophilia
description: A group of disorders characterized by lung involvement and increased eosinophils.

name: exudative pleural effusion
description: Pleural fluid collection with high protein content, often due to infection or malignancy.

name: solitary pulmonary nodule
description: A single rounded opacity in the lung less than or equal to 3 cm.

name: pedunculated intratracheal mass
description: A mass with a stalk projecting into the tracheal lumen.

name: enhancing mediastinal mass
description: A mediastinal mass that shows contrast enhancement, suggestive of neoplastic or vascular process.

name: vascular abnormality of mediastinum
description: Abnormal appearance or course of a vascular structure within the mediastinum.

name: wide superior mediastinum in an infant or child
description: Enlargement of the superior mediastinum in a pediatric patient that may indicate pathology or normal thymus.

name: pulmonary artery calcification
description: Calcification within the wall of the pulmonary artery.

name: coronary artery calcifications
description: Atherosclerotic calcifications of the coronary arteries

name: pneumothorax
description: Presence of gas or air in the pleural space.

name: ground-glass pulmonary opacity
description: Hazy increased lung opacity with preserved bronchial and vascular markings.

name: retrosternal mass
description: Mass located in the anterior mediastinum, behind the sternum.

name: Ventricular diameters
description: Measurements of the maximum diameters of the right and left ventricles of the heart.

name: mitral insufficiency
description: Inadequate closure of the mitral valve, causing regurgitation of blood into the left atrium.

name: aortic insufficiency
description: A condition where the aortic valve fails to close completely, causing regurgitation of blood into the left ventricle.

name: inferior vena cava obstruction
description: Blockage of the inferior vena cava, which can cause venous congestion and collateral circulation.

name: pleural effusion with enlarged heart
description: Pleural effusion seen in the context of cardiomegaly, suggestive of cardiac etiology.

name: dissecting aneurysm of the ascending aorta or arch
description: Dissecting aneurysm involving the ascending aorta or aortic arch.

name: cyanotic congenital heart disease with increased pulmonary vascularity
description: Cyanotic heart defects with increased blood flow to the lungs.
synonyms: cyanotic CHD with increased pulm blood flow

name: bronchial lesion
description: An abnormality or mass involving a bronchus.

name: left ventricular enlargement
description: Increased size of the left ventricle, often due to cardiac overload or disease.

name: asymmetric lung size
description: One lung is noticeably larger or smaller relative to the other.

name: pericardial effusion
description: Abnormal accumulation of fluid in the pericardial sac.

name: massive pleural effusion
description: A very large collection of fluid in the pleural space.

name: chemical-induced lung disease
description: Lung disease caused by exposure to toxic chemicals.

name: congenital tracheal stenosis
description: Narrowing of the trachea present at birth.

name: anomalous thoracic arterial communication
description: Abnormal vascular connection between thoracic arteries.

name: bilateral hilar enlargement
description: Increase in the size or density of the hilar regions, commonly due to lymphadenopathy or vascular causes.

name: cavitary lung lesion in an infant or child
description: Area within the lung containing an air-filled cavity, identified in pediatric patients.

name: enlarged pulmonary veins
description: Dilated pulmonary veins, often seen with left-sided heart failure or increased pulmonary venous pressure.

name: wide mediastinum
description: Increased width of the mediastinum, which may indicate mass, hemorrhage, or vascular anomaly.

name: thick-walled lung cavity
description: A lung cavity with relatively thick walls, often suggestive of infection or malignancy.

name: tracheal displacement
description: Abnormal shift of the trachea from its usual midline position.

name: acute disseminated airspace opacity
description: Widespread new opacity in the lung airspaces, suggesting acute pulmonary process.

name: chronic kerley lines
description: Persistent, fine linear lung opacities indicative of interstitial edema or fibrosis.

name: ventricular septal defect
description: A congenital opening between the right and left ventricles of the heart.

name: abnormal sternoclavicular joint
description: Any irregularity in the morphology or alignment of the sternoclavicular joint.

name: cardiac or pericardial neoplasm or cyst
description: A tumor or cystic lesion within the heart or pericardial space.

name: pleural effusion with disease in abdomen
description: Pleural fluid accumulation associated with abdominal pathology such as pancreatitis or cirrhosis.
synonyms: secondary pleural effusion due to abdominal disease

name: diffuse tracheal narrowing
description: Widespread reduction in tracheal diameter.

name: transudative pleural effusion
description: Accumulation of non-inflammatory fluid in the pleural space, usually due to systemic factors like heart failure or hypoalbuminemia.

name: diverticulum of upper esophagus
description: A pouch-like outpouching from the upper esophagus.

name: mucoid impaction
description: Plugging of bronchi with thick mucus, resulting in branching opacities.

name: coronary artery aneurysm
description: Localized dilatation of a coronary artery segment.

name: left atrial enlargement
description: Increased size of the left atrium, often due to cardiac or valvular disease.

name: acute respiratory distress syndrome
description: Severe acute pulmonary condition with diffuse alveolar damage and hypoxemia.

name: fat-attenuation mediastinal mass
description: A mediastinal mass with fat-density, characteristic of lipoma or thymolipoma.

name: ischemic heart disease
description: A group of heart conditions caused by reduced blood flow to the myocardium.

name: hypersensitivity pneumonitis
description: An inflammatory lung disease caused by repeated inhalation of environmental antigens.

name: acute lung injury and ards in children
description: Acute diffuse lung damage leading to hypoxia and bilateral infiltrates in children.

name: intrathoracic extramedullary hematopoiesis
description: Formation of blood cells in thoracic sites outside the bone marrow, often as paravertebral masses.

name: hemothorax
description: Accumulation of blood in the pleural space, usually due to trauma or rupture.

name: heart failure in childhood
description: Cardiac dysfunction leading to inadequate perfusion, presenting after infancy.

name: pneumopericardium
description: Presence of gas or air within the pericardial sac.

name: radiopaque hemithorax
description: Appearance of an entire side of the chest being abnormally dense on imaging.

name: biliary-pleural fistula
description: Abnormal communication between the biliary system and pleural space.

name: congenital heart disease
description: Structural heart abnormalities present from birth.

name: Breast density
description: Breast density refers to the proportion of fatty tissue to fibroglandular tissue in the breast as seen on a mammogram.

name: miliary lung opacities
description: Numerous small, diffuse, round pulmonary opacities throughout both lungs.

name: nipple anomaly
description: Abnormal development or appearance of the nipple.

name: congenital cardiomyopathy
description: Heart muscle disease present from birth.

name: solitary thoracic calcification
description: A single focus of calcification anywhere in the thorax.

name: solitary irregular cavitary lung lesion
description: A single lung lesion with irregular cavity, often raising suspicion for infection or malignancy.

name: abdominal aortic aneurysm
description: An abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) is a localized dilation of the abdominal aorta, typically defined as a diameter greater than 3 cm, which can lead to rupture and significant morbidity or mortality.

name: pleural calcification
description: Deposition of calcium in the pleura, often a sign of previous inflammation or asbestos exposure.

name: unilateral hilar enlargement
description: Increased size of the hilar structures on one side, often due to adenopathy or vascular abnormality.

name: solitary sharply-outlined cavitary lung lesion
description: A single lung cavity with distinct, smooth borders.

name: calcification in heart
description: Presence of calcified deposits within cardiac structures.

name: absent clavicle
description: Congenital absence of the clavicle, often associated with syndromes such as cleidocranial dysostosis.

name: indistinct heart border on frontal chest radiograph
description: Loss of the clear demarcation between the heart border and adjacent lung on frontal radiographs.

name: unilateral small hilar shadow
description: Diminished size of the hilar shadow on one side, often due to hypoplasia or prior surgery.

name: lung neoplasm
description: A primary or secondary tumor of the lung including benign and malignant lesions.

name: pulmonary lobar consolidation
description: Solidification of a whole pulmonary lobe due to replacement of air with fluid, cells, or other material.

name: juxtadiaphragmatic lesions in children
description: Lesions located adjacent to the diaphragm seen in pediatric patients.

name: retrocardiac lesion
description: Abnormal lesion located posterior to the heart.

name: peripheral lung lesion
description: A mass or nodule located towards the periphery of the lung fields.

name: air in esophagus
description: Presence of gas within the esophageal lumen, which may be normal or pathologic.

name: pulmonary segmental consolidation
description: Consolidation confined to a segment of the lung.

name: right atrial enlargement
description: Increase in the size of the right atrium, often due to cardiac or pulmonary disease.

name: large trachea
description: Abnormally increased diameter of the trachea.

name: thin clavicle
description: Clavicle appears abnormally thin, possibly due to dysplasia or chronic disease.

name: neonatal respiratory distress
description: Difficulty in breathing and inadequate oxygenation in a newborn.

name: mediastinal abscess
description: A localized collection of pus within the mediastinal spaces.

name: aortic arch anomaly
description: Congenital abnormality involving the aortic arch shape, course, or branching.

name: chronic pulmonary lobar consolidation
description: Long-standing opacity of an entire lung lobe due to consolidation.

name: eggshell calcification in the chest
description: Thin, peripheral calcification of lymph nodes, commonly in the mediastinum.

name: localized elevation of hemidiaphragm
description: Abnormal elevation of one side of the diaphragm often indicating underlying pathology.

name: interstitial lung fibrosis
description: Thickening and scarring of the lung interstitium.

name: late onset of cyanosis in neonatal congenital heart disease
description: Development of cyanosis after birth in neonates due to underlying congenital cardiac defects.
synonyms: delayed cyanosis in congenital heart disease

name: reverse butterfly pattern
description: Bilateral symmetric peripheral opacities with central sparing, resembling an inverted butterfly wing pattern.

name: lower lung disease
description: Disease predominantly affecting the lower lobes or zones of the lungs.

name: breast calcification cluster
description: Breast calcification clusters are typically a sign of benign changes in breast tissue but can sometimes indicate malignancy.

name: localized narrowing of esophagus
description: Focal constriction of the esophagus, which may be congenital, neoplastic, or due to inflammation.

name: pneumomediastinum
description: Presence of gas or air within the mediastinum.

name: oversegmentation of sternum
description: Presence of more than normal segments or divisions in the sternum.

name: hilar displacement
description: Abnormal position of the pulmonary hilum, often due to mass effect or lung volume loss.

name: middle mediastinal lesion
description: A mass or abnormality located within the middle mediastinal compartment.

name: heart failure in the first month of life
description: Cardiac failure occurring in infants less than one month old.

name: pulmonary disease in an immunodeficient patient
description: Any lung disease occurring in a patient with immune deficiency, including infections and neoplasms.

name: wide right tracheal stripe
description: An increased thickness of the right para-tracheal soft tissue stripe seen on chest radiograph.

name: small ascending aorta
description: Diminutive diameter of the ascending aorta, which can be developmental or associated with specific syndromes.

name: complete atrioventricular canal
description: A congenital heart defect with a common atrioventricular valve and septal defects.

name: localized pulmonary vessel enlargement
description: A segmentally enlarged artery or vein in the lung, sometimes associated with shunts or malformations.

name: generalized pulmonary arterial hypervascularity
description: Increased prominence and number of pulmonary arteries throughout the lungs.

name: right ventricular enlargement
description: Enlargement of the right ventricle, seen in pulmonary or cardiac pathology.

name: widespread small irregular lung opacities
description: Numerous small, non-uniform lung opacities scattered throughout both lungs.

name: lobar atelectasis
description: Collapse or loss of volume in an entire lobe of the lung.

name: centrilobular small lung nodules
description: Small nodules located in the centrilobular region of the lungs.

name: congenital heart disease with decreased pulmonary vascularity
description: Congenital heart defects associated with reduced blood flow to the lungs.
synonyms: cyanotic heart disease with reduced pulmonary blood flow

name: shaggy lung nodule
description: An irregular or spiculated lung nodule, often concerning for malignancy.

name: mass-like perihilar opacity
description: An opacity with mass effect near the hilum, possibly due to tumor, infection, or lymphadenopathy.

name: upper lung disease
description: Disease processes predominantly affecting the upper lobes of the lungs.

name: high-output heart function
description: State of increased cardiac output secondary to a variety of causes.

name: diffuse mixed airspace-interstitial lung disease
description: Combination of airspace and interstitial lung disease in a diffuse pattern.

name: acute diffuse fine reticular lung opacities
description: Widespread fine linear densities throughout the lungs often consistent with an interstitial process.

name: large main pulmonary artery
description: Widening or enlargement of the main pulmonary artery.

name: mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node enlargement
description: Enlargement of lymph nodes in the mediastinum and/or hilar lung regions.

name: systemic-to-pulmonary vascular shunt
description: An abnormal vascular connection between the systemic and pulmonary circulations.

name: thymic enlargement
description: Enlargement of the thymus gland, often seen in various conditions.

name: tracheoesophageal fistula
description: An abnormal connection between the trachea and esophagus.

name: nodular pleural thickening
description: Focal or diffuse thickening of the pleura with nodularity.

name: acyanotic congenital heart disease with normal pulmonary vascularity
description: Acyanotic congenital cardiac malformations with normal pulmonary blood flow.

name: large aortic arch
description: Enlargement or increased diameter of the aortic arch.

name: pleural thickening
description: Chronic inflammation or fibrosis causing a thickened appearance of the pleura.

name: periosteal reaction involving the clavicle
description: New bone formation along the surface of the clavicle, possibly due to infection, trauma or neoplasia.

name: sclerotic clavicle
description: Increased density or thickening of the clavicle seen on imaging.

name: diffuse interstitial disease with pleural effusion
description: Widespread interstitial lung disease with fluid in the pleural space.
synonyms: interstitial lung disease with pleural fluid

name: pleural effusion with normal lungs
description: Pleural fluid accumulation present when lungs appear otherwise normal.

name: small pleural effusion with subsegmental atelectasis
description: Minimal fluid accumulation in pleural space associated with collapse of a subsegment of lung.

name: esophageal rupture
description: A tear or perforation in the esophagus, leading to air or fluid leakage into the mediastinum.

name: tracheobronchomegaly
description: Abnormal dilatation of the trachea and bronchi, often congenital.

name: clavicle dysplasia
description: Abnormal formation or development of the clavicle.

name: mediastinal shift
description: Displacement of the mediastinal structures to one side, usually due to volume loss or mass effect.

name: cardiomyopathy
description: Diseases of the heart muscle causing impaired function.

name: pulmonary artery rupture
description: Tear or disruption of the pulmonary artery wall, often with bleeding.

name: cyanotic congenital heart disease with precapillary hypertension vascularity
description: Cyanotic heart disease with signs of pulmonary arterial hypertension.
synonyms: cyanotic CHD with precapillary pulmonary hypertension

name: fetal chest mass
description: A mass detected within the chest of a fetus, which may be congenital or neoplastic.

name: chronic air-space consolidation
description: Persistent opacification of the lung parenchyma due to filling of air-spaces.

name: premature tracheobronchial cartilage calcification
description: Early calcification of the tracheal or bronchial cartilages before the usual age.

name: pulmonary embolism
description: Pulmonary embolism is the occlusion of a pulmonary artery or one of its branches, typically caused by thrombi that originate from the deep veins of the legs or other parts of the body, leading to impaired gas exchange and potential hemodynamic instability.

name: congenital heart disease with anterior right aortic arch
description: Congenital cardiac malformation associated with aortic arch located anteriorly and to the right.
synonyms: right anterior aortic arch with congenital heart defect
